responsibilities: Formulate business problems as technical data problems while ensuring key business drivers are captured in collaboration with product stakeholders.
Work with product engineering to ensure implementability of solutions and deliver prototypes and production code based on need.
Experiment with in-house and third-party data sets to test hypotheses on relevance and value of data to business problems.
Build needed data transformations on structured and unstructured data.
Build and experiment with modeling and scoring algorithms, including development of custom algorithms and use of packaged tools based on machine learning, data mining, and statistical techniques.
Devise and implement methods for adaptive learning with controls on effectiveness, methods for explaining model decisions where necessary, model validation, and A/B testing of models.
Devise and implement methods for efficiently monitoring model effectiveness and performance in production.
Devise and implement methods for automation of all parts of the predictive pipeline to minimize labor in development and production.
Contribute to the development and adoption of shared predictive analytics infrastructure.
qualifications: Strong academic track record and excellent software engineering skills.
Ability to program in one or more scripting languages such as Perl or Python and one or more programming languages such as Java, C++, or C#.
Excellent understanding of algorithms and data structures.
Experience working with large datasets using tools like Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Hive, or Flink.
Strong attention to detail and excellent collaboration skills.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on formulating business problems as technical data problems, working with product engineering, experimenting with data sets, building data transformations, and developing modeling and scoring algorithms. The responsibilities also include adaptive learning, model validation, A/B testing, monitoring model effectiveness, and automating predictive pipelines. These tasks are related to data science and machine learning but do not explicitly mention Generative AI or language models.

The skills required include programming in scripting and programming languages, understanding algorithms and data structures, working with large datasets using tools like Hadoop and Spark, and having strong analytic and problem-solving capabilities. These skills are typical for data science and machine learning roles but do not specifically indicate working with Generative AI or language models.

Overall, while the job involves machine learning and data science, there is no explicit mention of Generative AI or language models in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on predictive analytics and data-driven solutions rather than generative or language model technologies.
